JProcessing

Class Processing.PFont

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Font
      • JProcessing.Processing.PFont
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    Processing

    public static class Processing.PFont
extends java.awt.Font
    PFont is the Font Class for JProcessing.

    PFont is A Subclass of Font, with the only Difference being the Constructors and one additional Method to List all Available Fonts. In Processing IDE, PFont is used as the Only Supported Font Class for its Methods. While in JProcessing, all Font related Methods Accepts the original Font Class as their Parameter, Leaving the main Purpose of PFont as Providing Compatibility for Processing Codes.

    One of the Issue in Processing IDE being that the Font will get Blurry when a PFont was Initially Constructed in a small Size and then being Displayed to the screen by a Larger Size. This is because that Processing IDE uses Image to Store each font Letter.(more details on their website links down below) This Issue does not Exist in JProcessing, since all Fonts are stored in Vector Data.

    Note that Although the Instructions on the Processing Website Forbids the Construction of PFont Class using Syntax new PFont(name,size), such Method is totally Allowed in JProcessing and will have the same result of Calling Method createFont(name,size).

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Font, PFont in Processing IDE, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PFont

        public PFont(java.lang.String name,
             @NotNull
             size size)
        Creates a new PFont from the specified font name and point size.

        The style of the font wil be set to plain.
        This constructor works exactly the same as method createFont(name,size).

        Type Parameters:
        size - any type of number
        Parameters:
        name - the font name, this can be a font face name or a font family name
        size - the point size of the Font

      • PFont

        public PFont(java.lang.String name,
             int style,
             @NotNull
             size size)
        Creates a new PFont from the specified font name, style and point size.

        The font name lookup is case insensitive.

        Type Parameters:
        size - any type of number
        Parameters:
        name - the font name, this can be a font face name or a font family name
        style - the style constant for the Font
        Should be one of the followings: PFont.PLAIN,
                  PFont.BOLD, PFont.ITALIC
        size - the point size of the Font

    • Method Detail

      • list

        public static java.lang.String[] list()
        List all available fonts supported by the platform JProcessing running on

        Returns:
        array of available fonts by their name in String[]
